title: Ukraine Latest: US, EU Pledge Crackdown on Sanctions Evasion
description: The US and the European Union pledged to step up the enforcement of sanctions on Russia and further choke off supplies and technology for its military.

title: California Town Forced to Evacuate After River Breaches Levee
description: Authorities ordered residents in the California farming town of Pajaro to evacuate early Saturday after a nearby river swollen by recent torrential rains breached its levee.

title: Biden Scraps Trump’s Air Force One Update, Keeps Its Iconic Look
description: The US president’s plane is getting a paint job — and it looks a lot like the old one.

title: Red Tide Flares Up on Florida Coast,  Burning Eyes and Killing Fish
description: SARASOTA, Fla. (AP) — Residents are complaining about burning eyes and breathing problems. Dead fish have washed up on beaches. A beachside festival has been canceled, even though it wasn't scheduled for another month.

title: Trump May Face Anonymous Jury in High-Profile Defamation Trial
description: Donald Trump and the New York author who claims he raped her in the 1990s may get an anonymous jury at their upcoming defamation trial — an unusual scenario for a civil case with high-profile litigants.

title: Ukraine Latest: US, EU Pledge Crackdown on Sanctions Evasion
description: The US and the European Union pledged to step up the enforcement of sanctions on Russia and further choke off supplies and technology for its military.

title: UK Plans £11 Billion Full Expensing Business Tax Break in Budget
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Jeremy Hunt will hand business a three-year, £11 billion tax break by replacing the UK’s most generous ever investment allowance with a temporary measure in next week’s budget, according a government official with knowledge of the matter.

title: Erdogan Warns Turkish Voters of ‘Disaster’ If Opposition Wins
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan warned voters that victory in May elections for the broadest-ever opposition alliance of his 20-year rule would be a catastrophe for the country.

title: Xi Cements His Hold on China, Big US Bank Fails: Weekend Reads
description: President Xi Jinping completed his shake-up of China’s top personnel this week, with the legislature voting to install a key ally and former aide as premier.

title: Bulgarian President Asks Azerbaijan Leader for More Natural Gas
description: Bulgaria’s President Rumen Radev asked Azerbaijan’s President Ilham Aliyev to supply more natural gas, saying integrating the gas networks of a number of European countries will help them to increase imports from the Caspian region.

title: France Braces for New Protests Against Macron’s Pension Reform
description: France is bracing for its seventh day of protests against the contentious pension reform of President Emmanuel Macron, with a growing majority opposing the overhaul.

title: Ramaphosa Receives Graft Ombud’s Report on Cash-in-Sofa Scandal
description: South Africa’s presidency said it received a report from the graft ombudsman on its investigation into the theft of foreign-exchange from President Cyril Ramaphosa’s game farm, and reiterated he did nothing wrong.

title: Ukraine Latest: US, EU Pledge Crackdown on Sanctions Evasion
description: The US and the European Union pledged to step up the enforcement of sanctions on Russia and further choke off supplies and technology for its military.

title: UK Tories Fear Sunak’s Immigration Gamble May Fail to Pay Off
description: The British prime minister has made stopping small boats crossing the English Channel one of his five priorities. But members of his own party worry he’ll fail.

title: Ukraine Latest: US, EU Pledge Crack Down on Sanctions Evasion
description: The US and the European Union pledged to step up enforcement of sanctions on Russia and further choke off supplies and technology for its military.

title: Ukraine Latest: US, EU Pledge Crack Down on Sanctions Evasion
description: The US and the European Union pledged to step up enforcement of sanctions on Russia and further choke off supplies and technology for its military.

title: Federal Police Summons India Minister in Bribery Probe, PTI Says
description: India’s top investigating agency summoned a senior minister from a ruling coalition party in the state of Bihar to be questioned in a probe into potential bribery, the Press Trust of India reported, citing officials that it didn’t name.

title: Germany Turns Page on Economic Abyss With Sign of Green Shoots
Greek Train Crash Raises Doubts About Mitsotakis’s Election Push
description: The worst rail accident in Greece’s history is starting to hurt Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis as he gears up for a general election this year.

title: Thai King’s Younger Daughter is Appointed as Army Major General
description: Thai Princess Sirivannavari Nariratana Rajakanya has been appointed as a specialist in the Royal Thai Army with the rank of major general, according to the royal gazette.

title: Saudi Fund Has ‘Inconsistent’ Stance on Kingdom Ties, PGA Says
description: Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund, which bankrolls LIV Golf, casts its relationship with the oil-rich kingdom to suit its financial interests, but that’s not a good reason for it to be excused from US court proceedings, the PGA Tour Inc. said in an antitrust battle with its rival upstart.

title: Trump Fixer Cohen to Testify to Grand Jury Probing Hush Payment
description: Michael Cohen, Donald Trump’s former personal lawyer and fixer, is expected to testify Monday before a grand jury weighing whether the former president should be criminally charged over his role in hush money payments to a porn star during his 2016 campaign, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: Pentagon Puts Priority on Replacing Munitions in 2024 Budget
description: The Pentagon’s $170 billion procurement request for the new fiscal year focuses on replacing munitions supplied to Ukraine as well as well as weapons like long-range missiles, which would be necessary in a conflict with China, according to an internal budget document.

title: Fallout From Lineker Suspension Continues With Boycott of MOTD
description: Saturday's Match Of The Day will go ahead without a presenter, pundits and several regular commentators, following the fallout over Gary Lineker's suspension from the BBC show.
